title: Best Exercise For Pregnant Women | 30-Minute Pregnancy Exercises For Easy Delivery
description:
I get asked all the time for a the best exercise for pregnant women.  "You have so many videos...Is there just one that I can do daily?" Today's video is a routine with a little of everything to keep you and your baby healthy and prepare for an easy delivery! We will warm up, get the heart pumping with cardio, do some hip openers, asymmetrical poses, pelvic floor and core work and get baby is an optimal fetal position.  I hope you feel great after these pregnancy exercises! Safe for first trimester, second trimester and third trimester!

Natural Birth Preparation Playlist: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRuFBUMIEg8D-ztAOzvozZojBAzobeBjn

Disclaimer: This is general prenatal fitness only. Please check with your doctor or health care provider to see if this video is safe for you. You are responsible for your own safety. Don’t do anything that feels unsafe for you or baby. Stop if you have any pain or discomfort, bleeding, chest pain or shortness of breath, dizziness or if you feel unwell. P&P Health Inc., Pregnancy and Postpartum TV and Jessica Pumple are not liable in any way for any injury, loss, damages, costs or expenses suffered by you in relation to this video or its content. 


Jessica Pumple is a registered dietitian, and pre & postnatal fitness instructor.  She helps pregnant women stay fit, have healthy babies, and easier labors. She helps new moms with postpartum recovery, to heal and strengthen their core and lose the baby weight.

If you enjoy our content subscribe to our channel, hit the bell button, leave a comment, and share with your friends so I can make you more of the videos you enjoy!

channelDescription:
Passionate about spreading positivity, confidence and encouragement for a healthy and fit pregnancy, an easier delivery and fast recovery postpartum!

I have 400+ free pregnancy and postpartum workouts in many different styles: Yoga, HIIT, Pilates, Dance, Diastasis Recti Safe & More.

*Check out my Birth Education Playlist to create your positive and empowering birth experience.

*Heal and flatten your core after birth using my DIASTASIS RECTI Playlist.

I hope you find something helpful here on the channel and I’m so grateful to be able to share my passion and life with you!

Jessica Pumple
Registered Dietitian
Yoga & Fitness Instructor
Certified Pregnancy and Postpartum Core Exercise Specialist

Contact: support@pregnancyandpostpartumtv.com

comments: Congratulations on your pregnancy! You can check out my natural birth preparation list here: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRuFBUMIEg8D-ztAOzvozZojBAzobeBjn

Hello! This is my second time being pregnant, and I'm only a little over 6 weeks along. My first pregnancy didn't go beyond 7 weeks, and I was devastated. I'm not gonna lie: I'm still recovering mentally and emotionally from it since it happened in the middle of last year. I'm hoping I make it beyond the 7 weeks this time, but it's not easy: I'm already considered a high risk pregnancy with only one kidney, and I'm taking the necessary time off from work to help reduce my stress. However, it is making me very restless. I got back into yoga just shortly before I found out I was pregnant, and your videos have helped me tremendously! Thank you so much! I'm trying to stay positive for myself, my baby, and my husband! I'd welcome any and all healing vibes- and I'll be sure to give quite a few back to you all! Be well! ❤

alhamdulillah I am very grateful to find this video, currently I am pregnant with my 7th child at the age of 40. I pray that Allah will ease the pregnancy process until delivery for me and all of us who are currently pregnant.
Almost 33 weeks pregnant and trying to do 2-3 videos of yours a week plus daily walks. Preparing for the big day!

Im not very active. I’m 29 weeks 5 days today. I stopped at 13:23 this is hard when you aren’t a very active person. I have hardwood floors and I need to figure out something to help ease the pain off my knees and hands when on the ground. I don’t have a mat and the rug I have doesn’t feel different than the floor. Tomorrow I’m going to try again but I am out of breathe and my hands and knees hurt. 😅 I know this won’t compare to labor pain but I’m still proud of myself.
